I had been mulling over having this talk since yesterday but wasn‚Äôt sure how to go about it. I even considered asking for tips on Twitter, but recognized that I was just stalling so I took the plunge. If you have any tips, please share #ArewaMeToo
I told her about the importance of using a condom even if she has only one partner or intends to get married to her boyfriend and that consent applies even in a relationship #ArewaMeToo

I described what would follow if she ever reported to me. I assured her I would not ask why she was there or what she was wearing. I reminded her that none of those things are an excuse for rape. #ArewaMeToo

I told her that HIV/AIDS are not the only diseases that can be contracted through sex and that there are treatments for most of them. I assured her the stigma is not worse than dealing with STDs. #ArewaMeToo
I described some of the measures that can be taken against the perpetuator. I also shared some stories of victims and told her about the #ArewaMeToo movement.

I tried my best to debunk the culture of silence for fear of stigma. I told her that she should not keep it to herself for fear of further abuse or fear of never getting married. I described all the ways her identity & privacy would be protected if the need arises #ArewaMeToo

I assured her that if she ever wanted to report any form of sexual or physical abuse to me, I would believe her. I told her rape/abuse has nothing to do with her attitude, dressing or other factors. #ArewaMeToo

I told her about the dangers of being forced to have a baby she would have to take care of, I told her getting pregnant would not automatically result in her losing her job with me. I told her she has options #ArewaMeToo

I asked her if she is having sex and when she started but also mentioned that the answer did not actually matter to me or the conversation. Then, I asked her if she knows what rape is before explaining consent and sexual abuse using various scenarios. #ArewaMeToo

I started by telling her that since we are both women and she works and lives in my house, we are more or less like sisters. I told her I‚Äôm not here to judge her and that whatever she feels or does, I‚Äôve most likely already experienced or am still experiencing. #ArewaMeToo
Most of us including me focus on protecting and educating our own kids but we need to feel responsible for all young people especially women around us. #ArewaMeToo

I just had a talk with my 19 year old domestic staff about sex, rape and consent. It was rather awkward because she is an adult; I‚Äôve always imagined doing so with my children from a young age. #ArewaMeToo
